definitions.definition: an act of causing death, especially deliberately.
examples: murder, assassination, homicide, manslaughter, elimination, putting to death, execution; Morehonor killing; slaughter, massacre, butchery, carnage, bloodshed, extermination, annihilation; literaryslaying "a brutal killing"Morehonor killing; slaughter, massacre, butchery, carnage, bloodshed, extermination, annihilation; slaying a brutal killing

definitions.definition: causing death.
exhausting; unbearable.
overwhelmingly funny.
cause the death of (a person, animal, or other living thing).
examples: her father was killed in a car crash
synonyms: smoke; euphemisticneutralize; literaryslay "gangs killed twenty-seven people"

definitions.definition: get rid of or destroy completely, especially in large numbers.
examples: there is every possibility all river life would be killed off for generations

definitions.definition: (of a writer) bring about the “death” of a fictional character.
put an end to or cause the failure or defeat of (something).
examples: the committee voted to kill the project
synonyms: scuttle "this would kill all hopes of progress"veto
squash "an opposition attempt to kill the bill"

definitions.definition: stop (a computer program or process).
switch off (a light or engine).
examples: turn off, switch off, stop, shut off/down, cut Noel killed the engine

definitions.definition: delete (a line, paragraph, or file) from a document or computer.
consume the entire contents of (a bottle containing an alcoholic drink).
(in tennis and similar games) hit (the ball) so forcefully that it cannot be returned.
(in soccer or other ball games) make (the ball) stop.
neutralize or subdue (an effect or quality).
examples: the sauce would kill the taste of the herbs
synonyms: subdue "a shot to kill the pain"

definitions.definition: overwhelm (someone) with an emotion.
overexert oneself.
examples: I killed myself carrying those things home
synonyms: knock out "you must rest or you'll kill yourself"

definitions.definition: used hyperbolically to indicate that someone will be extremely angry with (another person).
examples: my parents will kill me if they catch me out here

definitions.definition: cause pain or anguish to.
synonyms: be uncomfortable "my feet were killing me"

definitions.definition: pass (time, or a specified amount of it), typically while waiting for a particular event.
examples: when he reached the station, he found he actually had an hour to kill
synonyms: waste "we had to kill several hours at the airport"
